alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Anderson; Greater Greenville; Greenwood; Laurens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 9:41AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Laurens, southeastern Greenville, Spartanburg, eastern Anderson, northern Abbeville and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 1015 AM EDT... At 941 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles north of Greenville Downtown to 14 miles southeast of Hartwell. Movement was south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Spartanburg, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Five Forks and Fountain Inn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Abbeville; Anderson; Greater Greenville; Greenwood; Laurens
